description.narrative: Supports the following illustrative program-funded costs: salaries of US, FSN, and TCN and other staff such as PSCs, RSSAs, PASAs, CASUs working for the US Government managing, administering, and supporting programs and their program-funded benefits such as housing, travel, transportation, education allowances etc; institutional contractors that provide such staff, rent, IT services, the program-funded share of utilities, staff training costs and the cost of developing and administering training programs, equipment and supplies, ICASS, vehicle fuel and maintenance, maintenance contracts, janitorial services, operational unit web page development and maintenance, outreach such as publications and the cost of their preparation (including staff costs), and technical assistance to ensure USG compliance with regulations.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

participating-org.narrative: Foundation for Legal Aid, Research and Empowerment

receiver-org.narrative: Foundation for Legal Aid, Research and Empowerment

description.narrative: Advance protection of international human rights, including labor rights, not covered under other elements. This element supports governmental and nongovernmental organizations created to protect, promote, and enforce human rights. Support programs to educate governments on incorporating human rights standards and practices into all government activity.

title.narrative: USAID Promoting Rights and Justice in The Gambia

description.narrative: (Gambia, The): FY 2022 funds will support the USAID Promoting Rights and Justice activity in The Gambia to protect and promote the advancement of civic and political rights of Gambian citizens and civic entities. The purpose of this activity is to: 1) advance citizen knowledge of, use of, and ability to shape the law in order to exercise their civil and political rights in a safe manner, and 2) improve the functionality of the justice system to protect the rights of all Gambians. Interventions under this activity are focused on improving capabilities of institutions within the justice sector, including both state and non-state entities, and complementing the work of the Truth, Reconciliation, and Reparations Commission and the Janneh Commission. Results will include increased functionality and accountability of the justice sector. Interventions will also support the strengthening of civil society and media organizations in The Gambia through organizational and financial capacity development, training programs, institutional network building, and activity-based support that is closely linked to rights and justice objectives. Activities will include training, coaching and mentoring, policy reform, reform of administrative systems and processes, public outreach and advocacy, and capacity strengthening. ..

description.narrative: Support the implementation of the Presidents Malaria Initiative (PMI), related malaria control programs, and malaria research activities to reduce malaria-related mortality. Develop effective malaria vaccines, new malaria treatment drugs, and targeted operations research.

title.narrative: USAID Title II Emergency Program through World Food Program.

description.narrative: USAID Title II Emergency Program through World Food Program.

Provide goods, personnel, services and assistance to meet basic human needs in order to foster transition from relief according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity. This element should be done, when possible, as part of an integrated, coordinated and/or multi-sectoral approach.

title.narrative: Democracy and Human Rights Fund (DHRF) Program

description.narrative: Democracy and Human Rights Fund (DHRF) Program supports the promotion of human rights. DHRF activities include but are not limited to the assistance for free press, the fight against female genital mutilations, the eradication of vestiges of slavery, encouragement of good governance. In short, DHRF resources are used for small, short-term, high impact activities with the goal of encouraging change. .
